articles.title: Mongolian President on Development of Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Mongolian President on Development of Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador Hong Kyu made a farewell call on Khaltmaa Battulga, president of Mongolia, on Nov. 23.
					 The president stressed that he would pay deep attention to the development of the relations between Mongolia and the DPRK, saying that the bilateral relations are traditional and special relations.

articles.title: Participants in National Meeting of Activists in Field of Fruit-Growing Tour Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Participants in National Meeting of Activists in Field of Fruit-Growing Tour Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- Participants in the national meeting of activists in the field of fruit-growing visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They went round the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum and the historical mementoes at the old home of the President, recollecting the revolutionary careers of the President and his patriotic and revolutionary family members.
					
					 The participants also visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt Taesong to lay bouquets at the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war heroine.
					
					 They went round the Korean Revolution Museum and the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
					
					 They also toured the Sci-Tech Complex, the Natural History Museum and the Central Zoo.

articles.title: Exhibition of Educational Scientific Achievements Held
articles.content:
Exhibition of Educational Scientific Achievements Held
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of educational scientific achievements took place on Nov. 25-26 to mark the 4th anniversary of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's visit to Pyongyang University of Architecture.
					Presented to the exhibition were more than 23,000 data in the forms of chart and multimedia as well as actual objects which teaching staff and students of the university have made in their researches for the past four years.
					
					 Also put on display were architectural design layouts of monumental edifices worked out by teachers and researchers of the university and various certificates.
					
					 Many textbooks and references and scientific research achievements paying off in practice were highly appreciated at the exhibition.

articles.title: Agitation Activities for Increased Production Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Agitation Activities for Increased Production Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- More than 130 art squads and itinerant art squads in Pyongyang and provinces of the DPRK have conducted thousands of rounds of agitation activities for increased production on major economic sectors in recent one month.
					 Members of the central art squad waged agitation activities at the Pukchang Thermal Power Complex, heartening its employees who turned out in the struggle for increased electricity production.
					
					 Such brisk agitation activities were witnessed at the Pukchang Area Youth Coal Mining Complex, coal mines in Kowon area, the Kumsong Tractor Factory and other industrial establishments and on farm fields across the country.
					
					 Members of the Kangwon Provincial Art Squad went to fishing bases like the Thongchon Fishery Station to give them aiding materials and conduct dynamic agitation activities.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Delegation of Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Delegation of Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un on Saturday received a letter from the members of a delegation of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan which took part in the 3rd National Conference of Social Scientists.
					 The letter said that the 3rd conference guided by the Supreme Leader was of significance in demonstrating the faith and will of the participants to defend and add luster to the idea and exploits of the peerlessly great men and usher in a fresh heyday of the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist social sciences under his leadership.
					
					 Through the conference, the Korean social scientists in Japan came to more deeply grasp the idea and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who pioneered the Juche-based social sciences and set a model of social sciences in the era of independence, said the letter, adding:
					
					 During the stay, we visited the Pyongyang Kim Jong Suk Silk Mill, the Ryuwon Footwear Factory and other units associated with the leadership exploits of the peerlessly great men and, in the course, witnessed the indomitable struggle of the people in the homeland who turned out in a drive to implement the decision made at the 2nd plenary meeting of the 7th Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea. And we came to cherish deep in our mind the faith that the victory of the homeland advancing on the strength of self-reliance and self-development is science and nothing can check such progress.
					
					 We will actively explain the invincibility of the best socialist system in our country in a scientific and theoretic way and conduct a fierce theoretical activities to lay bare the reactionary nature of imperialism and the inevitability of its ruin, with the unshakable faith that the overseas social scientists have the embrace of the Supreme Leader though science knows no frontiers.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Regime's Act of Treachery
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Regime's Act of Treachery
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime is going busy, currying favor with its U.S. master by letting out such senseless rhetoric as "supporting and welcoming" the U.S. act of re-listing the DPRK as a "terror sponsor" and praising the measure as a "timely one". It also calls for taking measures to cope with possible "rebuff and surprise provocation from the north".
					 An article of Rodong Sinmun Sunday describes the puppet forces' desperate moves to put sanctions and pressure on the DPRK as a revelation of their sinister intention to undermine and do harm to the ideology and social system of the DPRK, with the help of outsiders.
					
					 The present puppet ruling forces have to draw a lesson from the miserable fate of their predecessors who met shameful ends while getting keen on escalating confrontation with the fellow countrymen in collusion with outsiders, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak and Park Geun Hye groups of traitors had worked hard to inflict sanctions and pressure on the DPRK with the backing of outsiders till the last moments of their withdrawal from Chongwadae since the first days of their office. But they only revealed their weakness and wretched appearance as losers.
					
					 The puppet forces have to ponder over the consequences to be entailed by their confrontation act of actively pursuing the U.S. moves for sanctions and pressure on the DPRK. It is as pointless as waiting for the sea water to get dry for the puppet forces to try to expect "effect of their sanctions".
					
					 The group of traitors standing against the fellow countrymen in collusion with outsiders has always faced miserable ends.
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime is working with bloodshot eyes to impose harsher sanctions and pressure on the DPRK while chiming in with the Trump group's tyrannical act of re-listing the DPRK as a "terrorist sponsor", but it will only be made to pay a dear price for such acts of treachery.

articles.title: U.S. Gangster-like Threatening Diplomacy Rejected
articles.content:
U.S. Gangster-like Threatening Diplomacy Rejected
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- U.S. Secretary of State Tillerson held a trade security meeting with the diplomatic authorities of more than 30 African countries in Washington D.C. recently. There, he pressurized those African countries to downgrade the level of diplomatic relations with the DPRK and cut off economic relations with it.
					 Commenting on this, leading newspapers of the DPRK Sunday brand his act as an expression of the policy of threat and pressure of a rogue state.
					
					 His brigandish act is a last-ditch effort of those thrown into extreme hopelessness and setback, being unable to find any other way to check the DPRK's measure of increasing the nuclear capabilities to the highest level, Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:
					
					 Tillerson called on even African countries to cut off all the relations with the DPRK. This is little short of admitting its defeat in the one-to-one nuclear stand-off with the DPRK that has persisted century after century. The U.S. has become so exhausted and fallen on hard times in confrontation with the DPRK that it has now stretched its hands for help even to the African countries which it has so far regarded only as targets of exploitation and plunder.
					
					 The nuclear force of the DPRK is targeted against the U.S. which is working desperate to undermine the sovereignty and rights to existence and development of the DPRK. There is no need whatsoever for the African countries to feel any threat from the nuclear deterrence of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK is a country that has instilled those African countries which were moaning under the oppression of colonial rule by the imperialists with the rays of the Juche idea and rendered disinterested aid and assistance to those countries in their struggle for national liberation and building of new society. Those African countries can not harbor any feelings of hostility and grudge against the DPRK. However, the U.S., being unaware of what those African countries think about, is forcing them to implement the UN "sanctions resolution" for no reason. The U.S. act can not but be a gangster-like one.
					
					 Minju Joson says that Tillerson's demand on African countries to "cut off all relations with north Korea" only disclosed the shameless and gangster-like nature of the U.S. which pursues only anachronistic hegemonic strategy, while failing to discern the trend of the times.

articles.title: Repeal of SL and Anti-DPRK Policy Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeal of SL and Anti-DPRK Policy Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea held the 1146th Thursday rally in Seoul on Nov. 23, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 The speakers at the rally charged that the "Security Law", an undemocratic evil law, has violated democracy of the south Korean society and human rights for more than half a century.
					
					 They demanded the abolition of all fascist evil laws including SL.
					
					 They also urged the "government" to reject the unreasonable act of the U.S. which has imposed sanctions on the DPRK for more than 70 years, while getting keen on demonstration of military strength through introduction of aircraft carriers into the waters off the Korean peninsula, and make contribution to realizing the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 The U.S. recently re-listed the DPRK as a "terror sponsor" and took new sanctions measures, they said, deriding it as an ineffective step.
					
					 They urged the "government" to stop the joint military drills with the U.S., withdraw THAAD deployment and ensure peace on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korea: KCTU Launches Sit-in for Workers' Vital Rights
articles.content:
S. Korea: KCTU Launches Sit-in for Workers' Vital Rights
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) launched a sit-in on Nov. 23 in demand of the right to existence of workers, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 At a press conference outside the "National Assembly" building, the confederation declared that it is starting a sit-in for the realization of five priority tasks, the abolition of evil labor law and enactment of the law on labor reform.
					
					 The speakers demanded the immediate revision of labor law including the law on trade unions in order to build society where labor is respected and the right to the activities of trade unions is guaranteed.
					
					 A press release made public there declared that they would strongly protest and denounce those political parties and NA members who take the lead in retrogressive revision of labor law or who stand against the abolition of evil law on labor and the enactment of a bill on labor reform.

articles.title: Entry of U.S. Nuclear Submarine Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Entry of U.S. Nuclear Submarine Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- A measure council for checking the building of Jeju naval base in south Korea reportedly issued a statement titled "U.S. nuclear submarine's entry into Jeju naval base can never be allowed" on Nov. 23.
					 The statement said that the U.S. nuclear submarine Mississippi entered the Jeju naval base on Nov. 22, deploring the situation in which the base has been frequented by the U.S. forces' warships at will.
					
					 The entry of the U.S. nuclear strategic assets into the Jeju Island does not do anything helpful to defusing tension on the Korean peninsula, but will only further the military contradiction and conflict in Northeast Asia, it held.
					
					 Jeju Island has to be the one of peace, not the one for the preparation of a war, the statement emphasized, adding that this is the way for defending the future of the island and the peace of the Korean peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia.

articles.title: S. Korean Youth Organizations Denounce Illegal Act of Puppet Intelligence Service
articles.content:
S. Korean Youth Organizations Denounce Illegal Act of Puppet Intelligence Service 
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The Youth Popular Party, the Youth Citizens' Solidarity and the South Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century and other youth organizations in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 23 at which they rejected the puppet Intelligence Service's illegal act of preventing the application of the half registration fee for the students.
					 The speakers charged that the Lee Myung Bak and Park Geun Hye regimes committed to realizing half registration fee during their election campaigns but checked the application by setting in motion the Intelligence Service.
					
					 They urged the present "government" to realize the half registration fee for students, though belatedly. 
					
					 A press release disclosed that the puppet Intelligence Service put news report under its control to stop rallies demanding the provision of half registration fee and check the public opinion from being built over the issue.
					
					 It demanded that the present authorities carry out an investigation into the illegal act of the Intelligence Service and punish those responsible.

articles.title: Society Free from Part-Time Jobs Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Society Free from Part-Time Jobs Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The public transport trade union of south Korea held a press conference on Nov. 22, calling on the full-time trade unions of public institutions to pool efforts with part-time trade unions to abolish the part-time job system, according to Jaju Sibo, a south Korean internet newspaper.
					 The organization in a press release noted that officials of the public institutions appointed by the past "government" are opposing the conversion of part-time jobs into full-time ones.
					
					 This would not help realize the wish of the people nor can bring about a change in the serious bipolarization of society, a society where jungle law prevails, it said.
					
					 The organization said that the conversion of the part-time job system into full-time one is an urgent social issue, calling on workers to pool efforts and build society free from part-time jobs.

articles.title: 5th Meeting of Federation of Young Korean Nationals in China
articles.content:
5th Meeting of Federation of Young Korean Nationals in China
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The 5th Congress of the Federation of Young Korean Nationals in China was held in Shenyang of China on Saturday.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nyo, chairperson of the Federation, members of its Central Committee, representatives of its regional associations and Choe Un Bok, chairperson of the General Association of Koreans in China and officials of its headquarters and Koreans in China.
					
					 Kim Yong Nyo in a report noted that over the past years the Federation has strengthened itself in every way under the paternal love and trust of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, cherishing the patriotic loyalty to them.
					
					 The reporter reviewed the achievements made by the Federation in the patriotic movement for the prosperity of the socialist homeland and the work to reunify the country by the united efforts of the nation.
					
					 The chairperson set forth the tasks for further strengthening the Federation into an overseas youth vanguard firmly defending and glorifying the revolutionary feats of the peerlessly great persons of Mt Paektu and a patriotic organization contributing to the reunification of the country and the building of a powerful country as was pledged to the respected Marshal.
					
					 Then there were speeches by representatives of various regional associations.
					
					 The congress renamed the Federation of Young Korean Nationals in China the Association of Young Korean Nationals in China and announced the modified and supplemented rules of the organization.
					
					 There were also elections of the chairperson of the association and executive members and members of its Central Committee.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the Congress.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in DR Congo
Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo posted on its website the full text of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" on Nov. 21 ahead of the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the essence of Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his noble life dedicated to the country and the people.
					
					 It also clarifies the important matters arising in applying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Syria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Syria
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed by the Socialist Unionist Party of Syria on Nov. 16.
					 General Secretary Adnan Ismail was elected chairperson of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events in praise of Kim Jong Il's exploits in the period from Nov. 16 to Dec. 18.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Belarus
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Belarus
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- A Belarusian committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Minsk on Nov. 16.
					 L. Shukolinikov, chairman of the Permanent Standing Committee of the Belarus National Association of Friends of Korean People Named after Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits and organize political and cultural events including a remembrance meeting.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed by the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation on Nov. 15.
					 V. P. Isakov, first secretary of the Central Committee of the league, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee set a remembrance period from Nov. 15 to Dec. 24 and decided to organize political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il in the period.

articles.title: RPDC cumplira con su mision en la lucha por la justicia internacional
articles.content:
RPDC cumplira con su mision en la lucha por la justicia internacional
Pyongyang, 26 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar desde el 21 hasta el 23 en Turquia la X Sesion Plenaria de la Asamblea Parlamentaria Asiatica.
					　En la reunion efectuada bajo el tema de "Aseguramiento de la paz y el desarrollo de Asia", el jefe de la delegacion de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Jong Hyok, diputado a la APS y director del Instituto de la Reunificacion de la Patria, pronuncio un discurso que sigue:
					
					　Hoy dia, los pueblos asiaticos avanzan vigorosamente hacia un Asia pacifica y prospera eliminando las huellas de dominacion colonial de varios siglos de las potencias occidentales.
					
					　Sin embargo, la paz y el desarrollo del Nordeste de Asia, el Medio Oriente y otras partes de la region enfrentan todavia graves desafios debido a la invariable ambicion dominacionista de las potencias sobre el continente asiatico y sus actos de intervencion agresiva.
					
					　Sobre todo, la tension de la Peninsula Coreana, que se torna cada vez mas grave despues de la aparicion de la administracion Trump, provoca seria preocupacion de todo el mundo.
					
					　La amenaza de guerra nuclear de EE.UU. contra la RPDC es tan peligrosa que no se pudo ver ni el periodo de la Guerra Fria, mientras las sanciones contra la segunda llegan tambien a la etapa extremadamente aventurera y barbara.
					
					　EE.UU. disfraza la sancion como "solucion pacifica del problema", pero nunca puede encubrir el caracter de ese crimen antietico para aislar y sofocar con metodos primitivos a nuestro Estado y pueblo a que no pudo poner de rodillas con la amenaza nuclear.
					
					　La historia ensena que si es debil nuestro pais, puerta este del continente asiatico, la Peninsula Coreana se convierte en el campo de pugna de las potencias y todo el continente asiatico se cae en el crisol de guerras.
					
					　Guiados por el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, nuestro ejercito y pueblo consolidaran la fuerza propia levantando en alto la bandera de independencia y autoconfianza para frustrar rotundamente las imprudentes tentativas de guerra nuclear y las sucias maniobras de sancion y aplastamiento.
					
					　Asi cumpliran con su mision en la lucha por defender la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y Asia y verificar la justicia internacional.
					
					　Aseguro que el tema de la presente reunion se hara realidad sin falta cuando los pueblos de todos los paises asiaticos se unan bajo el ideal de la independencia, la paz y la amistad.
					
					　Y envio el apoyo total y solidaridad a los pueblos de los paises asiaticos, inclusive Iran, Siria y Palestina, que luchan por defender la soberania del pais rechazando la intervencion de las fuerzas extranjeras.

articles.title: Activistas de rama fruticola recorren varios lugares capitalinos
articles.content:
Activistas de rama fruticola recorren varios lugares capitalinos
Pyongyang, 26 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Los participantes en la reunion nacional de activistas de la rama fruticola visitaron a Mangyongdae, lugar sagrado de la revolucion.
					Tras recorrer el Museo de la Historia Revolucionaria de Mangyongdae, se dirigieron a la casa natal del Presidente Kim Il Sung donde pasaron revista a los objetos conservados y recordaron la vida del gran Lider y sus familiares patrioticos y revolucionarios.
					
					En el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios del Monte Taesong, depositaron ramos de flores ante el busto de la Heroina de Lucha Antijaponesa, Kim Jong Suk, y dieron una vuelta por el lugar.
					
					Ellos visitaron tambien varias salas del Museo de la Revolucion Coreana y el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria donde recordaron las hazanas del Presidente realizadas por ese triunfo.
					
					Estuvieron igualmente en el Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas, el Museo de la Naturaleza y el Parque Zoologico Nacional.
